titles.title: To provide that no insurer which is engaged in interstate commerce may exercise any right under a subrogation or reimbursement clause in an insurance policy until the insured has received full compensation.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Finance and Hazardous Materials.

bill.summary: 3/29/2000--Introduced. Prohibits an insurer engaged in interstate commerce from exercising any right under a subrogation or reimbursement clause in an insurance policy until the insured has been fully compensated for injuries and the insurer has made payment to the insured.
